meanings.definition: A person or thing that plucks.
meanings.sent1: The little plucker carefully picked the flowers from the garden.
meanings.sent2: The chicken farmer used a plucker to remove the feathers from the birds.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel turned into a plucker and started pulling out all the weeds.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a plucker, extracting the truth from the tangled web of lies.
meanings.sent5: The plucker in the story had magical fingers that could harvest stars from the sky.

meanings.definition: A device used for plucking feathers from poultry.
meanings.sent1: The automatic plucker made the task of preparing the chicken much easier.
meanings.sent2: The old-fashioned plucker was hand-cranked to remove the feathers gently.
meanings.sent3: The plucker machine seemed to have a mind of its own, dancing around the coop.
meanings.sent4: The plucker hummed a tune as it worked, like a bird singing while grooming its feathers.
meanings.sent5: The plucker's metal fingers delicately grasped each feather, one by one.

meanings.definition: A musician who plays the guitar by plucking the strings.
meanings.sent1: The talented plucker entertained the crowd with his melodic tunes.
meanings.sent2: She learned to be a plucker by practicing her fingerpicking technique every day.
meanings.sent3: The plucker's fingers moved so fast, it was like they were dancing on the strings.
meanings.sent4: His guitar was a loyal companion, responding to his every touch like a faithful plucker.
meanings.sent5: The plucker's performance was so captivating, it felt like the guitar was singing along with him.
